definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to explore/to probe
to investigate/to probe
to probe/to take readings/to explore/exploration
to explore/to survey/to prospect (for oil etc)/prospecting
to explore/to go on an expedition/adventure
detector/probe/craft
to visit/to call on sb/to look around
to go home to visit one's family
to seek by inquiry or search/to call on/to visit
to sound out/to probe/to feel out/to try out
to ascertain/to verify
to investigate/to delve/to probe/to enquire into/to look into
to extend one's head (out or into)/a probe/detector/search unit
to search/to seek/to explore
detective/to do detective work

sentences.english: Arnesen has been given the role of head talent scout, in charge of uncovering football talents.
sentences.chinese: 阿内森被任命为球探总管，负责发掘足球天才。

sentences.english: Vinegar-faced Joseph projected his head from a round window of the barn.
sentences.chinese: 苦脸的约瑟夫从谷仓的一个圆窗里探出头来。

sentences.english: She leaned out of the window and hailed a passerby.
sentences.chinese: 她探出车窗口，向一个过路人打招呼。

sentences.english: He poke his head round the door to see if she is in the room.
sentences.chinese: 他在门口探一下头，看她是否在屋里。

sentences.english: Such as wiretapping mode called "sniffer base on intermix mode".
sentences.chinese: 这种窃听方式为“基于混杂模式的嗅探”。

sentences.english: Just about this moment the scouts came to report that Cao Cao’s army had reached Bowang.
sentences.chinese: 正商议间，探马飞报曹兵已到博望了。

sentences.english: A new machine called 'The Revealer' has been invented.
sentences.chinese: 一种叫“探宝器”的新机器已经发明出来。

sentences.english: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.
sentences.chinese: 那时你们的祖宗试我探我，并且观看我的作为。

sentences.english: The cold wind howling, water ice, quiet night, the wind stopped the shadow.
sentences.chinese: 寒风啸，滴水冰，夜静风停探孤影。

sentences.english: The old circuitry will still show its head.
sentences.chinese: 过去的大脑电路依然想要探出头来。

sentences.english: This town was originally settled by gold prospectors .
sentences.chinese: 此镇原为探金矿者安身之处。

sentences.english: 'The Revealer' may reveal something of value fairly soon.
sentences.chinese: “探宝器”很快就会探出值钱的东西来。

sentences.english: Nor heaven peep through the blanket of the dark.
sentences.chinese: 让青天不能从黑暗的重衾里探出头来。

sentences.english: He leaned out of the window watching the parade.
sentences.chinese: 他从窗口探出身看游行。

sentences.english: The most determined, chocolate-loving kids will reach further, he said.
sentences.chinese: 只有那些最坚定的，爱吃巧克力的孩子才会探进去取。

sentences.english: I'm Detective Thomas Moore. This is Detective Rizzoli.
sentences.chinese: 我是莫拓森警探，这位是芮黎真警探。

definition: to visit/to go to see what's going on
to extend one's head (out or into)/a probe/detector/search unit
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to find out/to ascertain/to get an idea of
to stretch/to extend
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
see 山查[shan1 zha1]
to find a path
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
to watch/to look carefully at
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
variant of 鑽|钻[zuan4]
an auger/diamond
hidden/secret/latent/to hide/to conceal/to submerge/to dive
to push aside/to part/to brush away
to peep at/to spy on/to peek
everywhere
